page.title: 16The Crown Court Wallington
page.content:
The Crown Court was made into a court in 1980. It had been a town hall which had been opened in 1935 by Sir Richard Meller. The court got one award from The Times newspaper. Most of the court- rooms had no windows except for one. They select the jury from outside and can be male or female. They have to be from the age of 18 to 65 years old. They also have a shorthand writer. If he misses a bit he can see the mistakes he made by listening to a tape record- ing. All of the court rooms were very bright and had lots of light. One of the courtrooms had an emblem saying "DIEU ET MON DROIT." There is a piece of paper for the witness which says "Address your judge as your honour and please speak up."
By Holy Trinity School
